description.narrative: This project is designed to enhance the management effectiveness, biogeographic coverage and connectivity of Protected Areas of the Achara Autonomous Region of Georgia in order to better conserve the globally unique Colchic Forests
Enhanced PA Management Effectiveness in the Achara Region

description.narrative: PA System Expanded to increase functional connectivity of PAs in the West Lesser Caucasus
Extent ha of area surveyed and formally proclaimed and managed as Machakhela National Park IUCN Cat II

comment.narrative: 0 ha
Machakhela National Park covering 8733 ha by yr 2

PA official gazettement completed The Government of Georgia undertook efforts at the project development stage to legally establish the Machakhela NP This was agreed by Parliament in April 2012 Detailed boundary demarcation is currently in progress with the support of the project NP Administration has been established and equipped by the Agency of Protected Areas of Georgia Project has supported initial training of NP Administration staff awareness raising within local communities and establishment of the NP administration local authorities and project coordination group as well as refurbishment of NP temporary office within the Machakhela valley
Machakhela National Park covering 8733 ha by yr 2

PA official gazettement completed The Government of Georgia undertook efforts at the project development stage to legally establish the Machakhela NP This was agreed by Parliament in April 2012 Detailed boundary demarcation is currently in progress with the support of the project NP Administration has been established and equipped by the Agency of Protected Areas of Georgia Project has supported initial training of NP Administration staff awareness raising within local communities and establishment of the NP administration local authorities and project coordination group as well as refurbishment of NP temporary office within the Machakhela valley

description.narrative: Distance between the MtiralaKintrishi PA Complex and the nearest Forest Habitat PA

comment.narrative: 13 km to Jamili PA Turkey
Less than 6 km to Machakhela NP

After the transfer of landforest to the Machakhela National Park administration from the Forestry Agency of Achara Autonomous Republic in Autumn 2014 the territory is being managed as the protected area and thus the distance between the MtiralaKintrishi PA complex and the nearest forest habitat PA ie Machakhela NP is less than 6km The national boundary of Georgia and Turkey forms the southern boundary of the Machakhela NP The Jamilil Biosphere Reserve lies also along the border and thus the 3rd zone Transition zone is contiguous with Machakhela NP The Machakhela National Park admisnitration has accepted the legal ownershipmanagement of the for
Less than 6 km to Machakhela NP

After the transfer of landforest to the Machakhela National Park administration from the Forestry Agency of Achara Autonomous Republic in Autumn 2014 the territory is being managed as the protected area and thus the distance between the MtiralaKintrishi PA complex and the nearest forest habitat PA ie Machakhela NP is less than 6km The national boundary of Georgia and Turkey forms the southern boundary of the Machakhela NP The Jamilil Biosphere Reserve lies also along the border and thus the 3rd zone Transition zone is contiguous with Machakhela NP The Machakhela National Park admisnitration has accepted the legal ownershipmanagement of the for

description.narrative: Machakhela NP boundaries and zonation decided and participatory management plan in existence

comment.narrative: Boundaries only provisionally demarcated and zonation not carried out

Clearly defined and consensually agreed boundaries and zones by yr 2
Consensually agreed Management plan exists by yr 3

The project is well on track to meet the target expected date September 2015 A contract to undertake the detailed demarcation and land classification of the NP was selected in April 2015 by the project in agreement with APA The PA boundary demarcation is ongoing including the collection and inputting all existing cartographic land and field surveys data into GIS The contractor closely liaises and informs local government and communities on the progress during implementation of this task This activity is expected to be completed in September 2015 Additionally a contractor has been selected to undertake a detailed resource inventory of the NP and surrounding area baseline studies of biodiversity traditional use cultural heritage etc which will form the baseline for monitoring development of a zoning plan as well as the initial NP management plan scheduled for 2016 The contractor should start its work in August 2015 and complete by February 2016

Clearly defined and consensually agreed boundaries and zones by yr 2
Consensually agreed Management plan exists by yr 3

The project is well on track to meet the target expected date September 2015 A contract to undertake the detailed demarcation and land classification of the NP was selected in April 2015 by the project in agreement with APA The PA boundary demarcation is ongoing including the collection and inputting all existing cartographic land and field surveys data into GIS The contractor closely liaises and informs local government and communities on the progress during implementation of this task This activity is expected to be completed in September 2015 Additionally a contractor has been selected to undertake a detailed resource inventory of the NP and surrounding area baseline studies of biodiversity traditional use cultural heritage etc which will form the baseline for monitoring development of a zoning plan as well as the initial NP management plan scheduled for 2016 The contractor should start its work in August 2015 and complete by February 2016

description.narrative: Level of involvement of communities in the management and governance of the NP

comment.narrative: NA

PublicCivil SocietyCommunity PA Planning and Management Governance Board established with proper representation and involvement of local communities in the planning and management of the Machakhela NP by year 2

The Project Coordination Group established and operating that includes local government and community representatives The primary role of this group is to ensure coordination and information sharing during the next 2 years of intense activities to establish the functional capacity of the NP ie boundary and zoning NP Administration training infrastructure and equipment management plan development etc Its secondary important role includes the creation of a mechanism by which the NP and local stakeholders can constructively interact A study of existing and potential mechanisms for maximising practical and meaningful interaction and collaboration between communities living within the borderline of the NP or support zone and the protected area is to be commissioned in the 2nd half of 2015 The study will guide the project on most viable and feasible structures and mechanisms for ensuring community engagement and role in NP management that will be incorporated into the management planning process in 2016

PublicCivil SocietyCommunity PA Planning and Management Governance Board established with proper representation and involvement of local communities in the planning and management of the Machakhela NP by year 2

The Project Coordination Group established and operating that includes local government and community representatives The primary role of this group is to ensure coordination and information sharing during the next 2 years of intense activities to establish the functional capacity of the NP ie boundary and zoning NP Administration training infrastructure and equipment management plan development etc Its secondary important role includes the creation of a mechanism by which the NP and local stakeholders can constructively interact A study of existing and potential mechanisms for maximising practical and meaningful interaction and collaboration between communities living within the borderline of the NP or support zone and the protected area is to be commissioned in the 2nd half of 2015 The study will guide the project on most viable and feasible structures and mechanisms for ensuring community engagement and role in NP management that will be incorporated into the management planning process in 2016

description.narrative: Necessary infrastructure investment is made by APA and Achara authorities to establish effective management of the NP

comment.narrative: Zero
Approx 120000 USD

Both the Agency for Protected Areas and the local municipality have already committed significant resources to the establishment of the NP This includes baseline inputs such as staff basic as well as additional equipment additional used vehicle from APA and as agreed during PPG stage the refurbishment of 4km of the Machakhela valley road by the municipality has been completed during 20142015 project cost around 404000 US
Approx 120000 USD

description.narrative: To enhance the management effectiveness biogeographically coverage and connectivity of Protected Areas to conserve forest ecosystems in the Achara Region
Protected Area Coverage within the Achara Region increased

comment.narrative: Target achieved Following the official gazetting of the Machakhela National Park 29052012 Reg code 36006000005001016742 the PA coverage within the Achara region has increased by 8733 ha and currently makes 39202 ha total Source WWF Ministry of Environment of Georgia National Environment Agency Forest Agency Official demarcation of PA boundaries in progress

description.narrative: 1. Protected Area Coverage within the Achara Region increased to 39,202 ha. 2. Increased national and Achara PA Coverage of the Colchic Temperate Rain Forest by at least 1% and 5% respectively 3. Capacity development indicator score for protected area system Systemic: >20%, Institutional: >29% , Individual: >13% 4. Management effectiveness for Kintrishi PA Complex, Mtirala NP and Machakhela NP measured by METT scorecard: Mtirala METT Score: > 73%; Machakhela NP METT score:71% 5. No net increase in the illegal harvesting of wood and non-wood forest products 6. Reduction or no increase in illegal activity measured by % of patrols resulting in arrests or fines 7. Extent (ha) of area surveyed, and formally proclaimed and managed as Machakhela National Park (IUCN Cat II) - Machakhela National Park covering 8,733 ha by yr 2 8. Distance between the Mtirala/Kintrishi PA Complex and the nearest Forest Habitat PA is Less than 6 km (to Machakhela NP) 9. Necessary infrastructure investment is made by APA and Achara authorities to establish effective management of the NP equals Approx. 120,000 USD 10. Machakhela NP boundaries and zonation decided by yr2 and participatory management plan in existence 11. Level of involvement of communities in the management and governance of the NP

comment.narrative: 1. Protected Area Coverage within the Achara Region is 30,469 ha 2. National and Achara PA Coverage of the Colchic Temperate Rain Forest is 10.7% and 15% respectively 3. Capacity development indicator score for protected area system: Systemic: 14%, Institutional: 21%, Individual: 9%. 4. Management effectiveness for Kintrishi PA Complex, Mtirala NP and Machakhela NP measured by METT scorecard: Mtirala NP METT score:68%; Machakhela NP METT score: 11% 5. Illegal harvesting of wood and non wood forest products in Mtirala NP: 7.82 m3., in Kintrishi PA Complex: 0 m3 6. Illegal activity measured by % of patrols resulting in arrests or fines in Mtirala NP: 1.3% (12 incidents, 915 patrols) Kintrishi PA Complex: 0.37% (1 incident, 267 patrols) 7. Extent (ha) of area surveyed, and formally proclaimed and managed as Machakhela National Park (IUCN Cat II)- baseline level: 0 ha. 8. Distance between the Mtirala/Kintrishi PA Complex and the nearest Forest Habitat PA is 13 km (Jamili PA, Turkey) 9. No infrastructure investment made by APA and Achara authorities to establish effective management of the Machakhela. 10. Machakhela NP Boundaries only provisionally demarcated and zonation not carried out 11. Communities are not involved in the management and governance of the NP

1. Finalization of Machakhela NP administration office and visitor center rehabilitation (contributes to indicators 3,4,9) 2. Development of Machakhela National Park Management Plan and 3 year operational plan, provision of initial support for its implementation (Contributes to indicators 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10) 3. Address income generation opportunities for Machakhela and Mtirala PAs (contributes to indicators 3,4,9) 4. Testing of selected prevention/mitigation methods for Human wildlife conflict and (Contributes to indicators 4,5,6) 5. Address income generation and sustainable livelihood opportunities for communities residing in the support zone through implementation of community development initiatives, agriculture and sustainable natural resource usage activities and tourism development and promotion (Contributes to indicators 5,6,11) 6. Support financial sustainability of Mtirala NP and Machakhela NP Friends Association. Implementation of “Junior Rangers” program to Machakhela NP support zone. (Contributes to indicators 5,6,11) 7. Support the process of establishment of Machakheli Protected Landscape as a most viable alternative enabling protection of key biodiversity components as well as sustainable resource usage (contributes to indicators 1,2, 11). 8. Support communicating of project results, impact and lessons learned to key stakeholders and general public (contributes to indicators 1,2, 3,4,11).

1. Machakhela NP administration office interior renovation completed by APA, and front yard and surrounding infrastructure rehabilitation works completed by the project. Visitor’s centre exhibition concept developed and agreed with APA. Office furniture provided. 2. The management plan of Machakhela National Park approved by the Government of Georgia. 3. Study on income generation opportunities for Machakhela NP conducted and specific projects identified, feasibility assessed and agreed with APA. 4. Testing of Human wildlife conflict prevention/mitigation methods successfully completed, documented and promoted through printed and online media. 5. Viticulture and Wine toursm promotion activities in the Machakheli valley implemented with selected farmers; Wine presses route developed, marked and signs installed. Special vehicle for removal of waste form the Machakheli valley supplied (co-financed by Municipality). 6. “Junior Rangers” program implemented in Machakheli valley involving 5 schools and 60 pupils. Financial sustainability of Mtirala NP and Machakhela NP Friends Association addressed through development promotion of eco-excursion service program, that will be offered by MMPAFA from 2019. 7. Public consultations held and support from the local communities and municipality government on establishment of Protected Landscape (PL) secured. Document package on establishment of PL including Draft Law, explanatory note and situation analysis prepared and forwarded to the Government of Achara AR for further initiation of legal establishment procedure in the parliament of Georgia. Financing from Czech-UNDP Partnership fund received to hire expert to support Khelvachauri municipality in development required capacity for management the future PL. 8. Awareness meeting held for the entire staff of APA headquarters on project activities, outcomes and outputs, as well as other UNDP – APA cooperation projects; Press tour to communicate and promote project activities and results organized for national and regional media organizations; Project Impact, Lessons Learned and Recommendations report prepared, published and presented at the project final workshop.
